intro: Spermacoce milnei, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in umbels, and it is characterized by its smooth, elliptical leaves. Spermacoce milnei is typically found in grasslands and disturbed soils, and it can grow up to 1 meter in height. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, which are small and often dispersed by wind.
